sentences.en: The nature of work is changing rapidly in the digital age.
sentences.zh: 在数字时代，工作的性质正在迅速变化。

sentences.en: Remote work has become increasingly common since the global pandemic.
sentences.zh: 自全球疫情以来，远程工作变得越来越普遍。

sentences.en: Many companies now offer flexible working arrangements to attract talent.
sentences.zh: 许多公司现在提供灵活的工作安排来吸引人才。

sentences.en: However, this shift also brings new challenges for work-life balance.
sentences.zh: 然而，这种转变也给工作与生活平衡带来了新的挑战。

sentences.en: Employees must learn to set boundaries between their professional and personal lives.
sentences.zh: 员工必须学会在职业生活和个人生活之间设定界限。

sentences.en: Meanwhile, employers need to build trust and focus on results rather than hours worked.
sentences.zh: 与此同时，雇主需要建立信任，关注结果而非工作时长。

questions.q: What is the passage mainly about?
options: B. Changes in the nature of work
questions.analysis: 文章主要讨论数字时代工作性质的变化。

questions.q: What should employers do according to the passage?
options: A. Monitor employees' working hours closely
B. Focus on results rather than hours
C. Require everyone to work in the office
questions.analysis: 文中提到雇主需要关注结果而非工作时长。
